oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Study of exotic nuclei
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: HEMALATHA, M
KAILAS, S
GAMBHIR, YK
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: field-theory
cesium isotopic chain
exotic nuclei
laser spectroscopy
nuclear r.m.s. radii
relativistic mean field theory
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A high-sensitive fluorescence cell has been developed with an aim to perform laser spectroscopy of exotic nuclei. This fluorescence cell has been tested off-line for stable isotope Cs-133. Also, an investigation of the nuclear root mean square (r.m.s.) charge and neutron radii, and of the binding energies of the cesium long isotopic chain has been carried out in the relativistic mean field (RMF) and relativistic Hartree-Bogoliubov (RHB) formalisms. The RMF/RHB calculations are compared with the experimental data and are found to be in good agreement.
